intro: Cosmos stellatus, commonly known as the starry cosmos, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant features feathery, silver-green leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Cosmos stellatus is an annual herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its lightweight seeds are easily dispersed by the wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
